title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, charged with kidnapping and murder of sister Michelle Knox, pleads not guilty in Lynn District Court.
Authorities allege Smith made statements about killing Knox outside the Newhall Street apartment shortly before police arrival.
Court records impounded; Smith's past charges include pleading guilty to assault with a weapon and previous acquittals for serious offenses.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks, four QB hits, and three tackles for a loss against the Raiders.
Despite the loss, Landry expressed optimism about the defense's potential and the impact of new signings.
The Patriots struggled with containing the Raiders' passing game, allowing 362 yards, but limited them to 56 rushing yards.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews criticized the Patriots' ineffective run game during their 20-13 season-opening loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots managed only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, abandoning the run game after the first half.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized the need for a more efficient run game to balance the Patriots' offensive strategy.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will conduct his first Bruins training camp as head coach starting September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm emphasizes intensity and accountability, aiming to improve a Bruins team that went 33-39-10 last season.
Sturm's communication style is direct, modeled after coaches like Darryl Sutter, and he plans to enhance defense and power play.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert, of Worcester, is accused of kidnapping, raping, and attempting to murder a 7-year-old girl in 2017.
The girl, now 15, testified that Hubert threw her off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond after the alleged attacks.
The trial has encountered delays since 2020, with Hubert pleading not guilty and denying all allegations against him.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye discussed the possibility of Maye having too much on his plate with the Patriots' offense.
Maye commented on Bill Belichick's decision to ban Patriots scouts from UNC practices, aligning with Belichick's ongoing tension with the Patriots.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell struggled in his NFL debut with penalties and pressure impacting his performance.
Veteran Morgan Moses advised Campbell, highlighting the difficulty of Game 1 and the importance of learning from mistakes.
The Patriots faced continued offensive struggles, managing only 13 points in their season opener against a staunch defense.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, once compared to Stefon Diggs, was drafted in the sixth round in 2023.
Boutte's college career at LSU included an ankle injury and surgeries, affecting his early draft projections.
Boutte's strong preseason has placed him among New England's top receivers alongside Stefon Diggs and DeMario Douglas.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is moving its headquarters from Pawtucket, Rhode Island to Boston’s Seaport by the end of 2026.
The new Boston office at 400 Summer St. will cover 265,000 square feet and employ 700 full-time workers.
Governor Maura Healey and Mayor Michelle Wu support Hasbro's relocation and its contribution to local job creation.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Michelle Wu holds a 50-point lead over Josh Kraft in Boston's mayoral race, according to an Emerson College poll.
Wu's support among likely voters has grown from a 13-point lead in February to 72% against Kraft's 22%.
The preliminary election will narrow candidates before the general election on November 4, with Wu and Kraft as main contenders.
